criteria

criteria

Functions

Name Description
AvgAbsCor Calculate the Average Absolute Correlation
MaxAbsCor Calculate the Maximum Absolute Correlation
MaxProCriterion Calculate the Maximum Projection Criterion
coverage Compute the coverage measure for a design
dij Calculate the Inter-site Distance
discrepancy Discrepancy of a given sample
maximin Compute the maximin criterion for a given design. A higher value corresponds
mesh_ratio Compute the meshratio criterion for a given design
phi_p Calculate the phi_p Criterion

AvgAbsCor

criteria.AvgAbsCor(arr)

Calculate the Average Absolute Correlation

Parameters

Name Type Description Default
arr numpy.ndarray A design matrix required

Returns

Type Description
[float]: A positive number indicating the average absolute correlation
of input matrix

Examples

Calculate the average absolute correlation of example_LHD

>>> example_LHD = pyLHD.rLHD(nrows=5,ncols=3)
>>> pyLHD.AvgAbsCor(example_LHD)

MaxAbsCor

criteria.MaxAbsCor(arr)

Calculate the Maximum Absolute Correlation

Parameters

Name Type Description Default
arr numpy.ndarray A design matrix required

Returns

Type Description
float [float]: Positive number indicating maximum absolute correlation. Rounded to 3 digits

Examples

import pyLHD
example_LHD = pyLHD.rLHD(nrows=5,ncols=3)
pyLHD.MaxAbsCor(example_LHD)
0.3

criteria.MaxProCriterion(arr)

Calculate the Maximum Projection Criterion

Parameters

Name Type Description Default
arr numpy.ndarray A design matrix required

Returns

Type Description
[float]: Positive number indicating maximum projection criterion

Examples

>>> example_LHD = pyLHD.rLHD(nrows=5,ncols=3)
>>> pyLHD.MaxProCriterion(example_LHD)

coverage

criteria.coverage(arr)

Compute the coverage measure for a design

Parameters

Name Type Description Default
arr numpy.ndarray A design matrix. If design matrix is not within [0,1], the required

Raises

Type Description
ValueError Whenever number of rows is less than number of columns

Returns

Type Description
Coverage measure

Examples

>>> example_LHD = pyLHD.rLHD(nrows=5,ncols=5)
>>> pyLHD.coverage(example_LHD)

dij

criteria.dij(arr, i, j, q=1)

Calculate the Inter-site Distance

Parameters

Name Type Description Default
arr numpy.ndarray A design matrix required
i int A positive integer, which stands for the ith row of (arr) required
j int A positive integer, which stands for the jth row of (arr) required
q int The default is set to be 1, and it could be either 1 or 2. 1

Returns

Type Description
[float]: positive number indicating the distance (rectangular or Euclidean) between the ith and jth row of arr

Examples

Calculate the inter-site distance of the 2nd and the 4th row of example_LHD

>>> example_LHD = pyLHD.rLHD(nrows=5,ncols=3)
>>> pyLHD.dij(example_LHD,i=2,j=4)

Calculate the inter-site distance of the 2nd and the 4th row of example_LHD with q=2 (Euclidean)

>>> example_LHD = pyLHD.rLHD(nrows=5,ncols=3)
>>> pyLHD.dij(example_LHD,i=2,j=4,q=2)

discrepancy

criteria.discrepancy(arr, method='centered_L2')

Discrepancy of a given sample

Parameters

Name Type Description Default
arr numpy.ndarray A design matrix required
method str Type of discrepancy. Defaults to ‘centered_L2’. Options include: 'centered_L2'

Raises

Type Description
ValueError Whenever number of rows is less than number of columns

Returns

Type Description
Desired discrepancy type

Examples

Calculate the centered_L2 discrepancy of example_LHD

>>> example_LHD = pyLHD.rLHD(nrows=5,ncols=3)
>>> pyLHD.discrepancy(example_LHD)
# Calculate the L2 star discrepancy of example_LHD
>>> pyLHD.discrepancy(example_LHD,method='L2_star)

maximin

criteria.maximin(arr)

Compute the maximin criterion for a given design. A higher value corresponds to a more regular scattering of design points.

Parameters

Name Type Description Default
arr numpy.ndarray A design matrix. If design matrix is not within [0,1], the required

Returns

Type Description
Calculated maximin criterion

Examples

>>> example_LHD = pyLHD.rLHD(nrows=5,ncols=5)
>>> pyLHD.maximin(example_LHD)

Parameters

Type Description

Returns

Examples

phi_p

criteria.phi_p(arr, p=15, q=1)

Calculate the phi_p Criterion

Parameters

Name Type Description Default
arr numpy.ndarray A design matrix required
p int A positive integer, which is the parameter in the phi_p formula. The default is set to be 15 15

Returns

Type Description
[float]: a positive number indicating phi_p

Examples

Calculate the phi_p criterion for example_LHD with default settings

>>> example_LHD = pyLHD.rLHD(nrows=5,ncols=3)
>>> pyLHD.phi_p(example_LHD)

Calculate the phi_p criterion of example_LHD with p=50 and q=2 (Euclidean)

>>> pyLHD.phi_p(example_LHD,p=50,q=2)
